lines.text: They took your wife away in a balloon? Well you don't need the police, pal, you need a psychiatrist!
What're ya gonna do with those *pies*, boys?
I made it through Korea I can make it through this bullshit!
Whatta ya gonna do? Knock my block off?

We were up at "the top of the world" and we saw this shooting star and we decided to go look for it. But instead of finding the shooting star we saw this... this circus tent. And that's when we went inside, and that is when we saw those people in those... those pink, cotton candy cocoons. Dave, it was not a circus tent. It was something else.
What? What?
It was a space ship. And there was these things, these killer clowns, and they shot popcorn at us! We barely got away!
Killer clowns, from outer space. Holy shit!
[as Jo-Jo The Ice Cream Clown]

I'm Jo-Jo the ice cream clown, we'll give you a stick, you'll give it a lick. And it'll tickle you all the way down. Ice cream, ice cream, we brought our goodies here to you! A tasty treat for while you screw! Let's take a break! Cool off those hot lips with our frozen fruity bars! Icy-wicy, fudgy-wudgy bars. And everyone's frozen delight, the lick a stick!
[after just witnessing the blinding light]
Did you see that little ole sky doggie zip down there Pooh?
What in the blue blazes is the circus doing here in these parts?
I don't know Pooh, you know there's something kinda peculiar around here.
Where's the dang ticket booth?
[Discovering Pooh has been dognapped]
What in tarnation is going on here!
Where's my dog! Where's my Pooh Bear!
Nobody's gonna put me in a balloon again!
[last lines]
Do you think it's over?
Yeah, sure.
[after finding the big top in the woods]
Look Pooh, I love the circus. Maybe we can get some free passes.
[Watching the stars, suddenly a bright light appears and disappears]
Did you see that?
Yeah I saw that! That was incredible!
[after finding the Big Top]
Well I'll be greased and fried!
Isn't this place great or what? It looks like it was decorated by Klowns R Us.
...I'm supposed to read you your rights. But you're in *Mooney's* jail, and in Mooney's jail you ain't *got* no rights!
[first lines]
Look at this son of a bitch.
Paul, there's more important stuff to do than sell ice cream!

[Mike and Debbie are inside the alien's "circus tent"]
God, is this place great, or what? I mean, it looks like it was decorated by "Clowns R Us"!

[Feeling a little uneasy]
I don't know...
Hey, didn't you ever want to run away and join the circus?
I wanted to run *away* from the circus.
How come?

When I was five years old, my mom and my dad took me to the circus for the first time. Lion tamers, acrobats, tightrope walkers... I guess they were okay. But then, this little car drove up... and stopped right in front of *me*. Out jumped this huge clown. He jumped over to me... he lifted me right up out of my seat. Everybody was laughing, even my parents. Then he threw me up on his shoulders and he... he ran me out in the center ring. And all the other clowns started dancing around me... honking their horns and squeaking their noses. Their cakey white faces, and yellow eyes and dingy teeth, were tormenting me. I was terrified. I will never forget those horrible smiling faces as long as I live. Ugh!
Hey, don't worry. Nothing in here is going to hurt you.

[to Tricycle Klown]
Mean bike you got there.
[punks laugh mockingly]

[sarcastically eager]
Can I take a ride... pal?
[Klown shakes head no]
Can I beep the horn?
[Klown shakes head yes]

[sarcastically joyous]
Oh, thank you!
[proceeds to smash Klown's bike, punks laugh uproariously]

[to punks]
Shoulda' let the man ride his bike.
[more laughter]

[sarcastically remorseful]
I'm sorry, I... I seem to have broken your bike.

[as Tricycle Klown raises his fists]
What are you gonna do... knock my block off?
[Klown knocks Punk #1's head into a trash can]

[amid screams from punks]
Damn!
